Description: Under the terms of a settlement of Clean Air Act and Clean Water Act allegations, Alcoa agreed to pay a $2.4 million penalty; spend at least $5.4 million on a project to reduce and Indiana plant's generation of hazardous waste; and conduct a $1 million study of a new air pollution reduction technology. The settlement also required that Alcoa create a new $5 million wastewater treatment system.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2000/March/121enrd.htm

Description: Alcoa Mill Products Inc. agreed to pay $484,656.19 in back wages to 37 Hispanics and African-Americans as well as $35,516.88 to two women who all were rejected for job positions at the company's plant in Lancaster, Pa. The settlement resolved a finding by the U.S. Department of Labor that the company discriminated against Hispanic, African-American and female applicants for material handler positions. The company also agreed to spend at least $20,000 on equal employment opportunity, anti-harassment and sensitivity training for its workforce, including all managers and human resources personnel involved in hiring.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/opa/media/press/ofccp/OFCCP20111168.htm

Description: The settlement, resolving allegations of racial discrimination in an apprenticeship program, included $882,000 for class members, $1.1 million for legal fees and a $500,000 fund to develop a more diverse talent pool for the skilled trades.
Private Litigation Case Title: Maxey et al v. Alcoa, Inc et al
Info Source: https://www.publicjustice.net/case_brief/maxey-v-alcoa-inc/
